claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A table listing influenza vaccine products by trade name, presentations, age indication, antigen content (µg HA per 0.5 mL dose), route, and thimerosal content. It shows standard-dose IIV4 vaccines contain 15 µg HA per virus strain per dose and the recombinant RIV4 Flublok Quadrivalent contains 45 µg HA per virus strain per dose. Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent contains 45 µg HA per 0.5 mL per virus strain versus 15 µg/0.5 mL per strain for standard-dose IIV4 vaccines. The table shows Flublok contains 3× the HA antigen content per strain compared to standard-dose flu vaccines but does not provide any data on immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim in full. Note: Image is clear regarding antigen content but lacks immunogenicity data.
